name: Homemade Baked Beans with Bacon (Southern)
description: (Recipe video above) Southern baked beans in a thick savoury sauce with a touch of sweet and hint of tang. Loaded with BACON! Serve as a side, or have it for breakfast with bacon and eggs. It even makes a hearty meal itself - great for slopping up with bread!
recipeIngredient: 3 cloves garlic (, minced (or 1 1/2 tsp garlic paste))
3  x 400g / 14oz cans red kidney or other beans, drained and rinsed ((Note 1))
3/4 cup tomato passata / US tomato puree ((Note 3))
2 tsp mustard powder ((or 1 tbsp Dijon or American mustard))
3/4 tsp EACH salt & pepper (, plus more to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil over high heat (can skip oil if bacon is super fatty). Add bacon and cook for 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil over high heat (can skip oil if bacon is super fatty). Add bacon and cook for 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add onion and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes until onion and bacon are golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Add onion and garlic. Cook for 3 minutes until onion and bacon are golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Add remaining ingredients. Stir, bring to simmer, then place lid on.
recipeInstructions.name: Add remaining ingredients. Stir, bring to simmer, then place lid on.

recipeInstructions.text: Then either turn down heat to medium low (simmering gently) and cook on the stove for 1 hour, stirring every now and then so the bottom doesn't catch. OR bake at 160¬∞C/325¬∞F for 60 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Then either turn down heat to medium low (simmering gently) and cook on the stove for 1 hour, stirring every now and then so the bottom doesn't catch. OR bake at 160¬∞C/325¬∞F for 60 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: SLOW COOKER option: Reduce water to 1/4 cup, transfer to slow cooker and cook for 6 hours on low.¬†
recipeInstructions.name: SLOW COOKER option: Reduce water to 1/4 cup, transfer to slow cooker and cook for 6 hours on low.¬†

recipeInstructions.text: The sauce should be thickened (cook with lid off for a bit if not thick enough) and glossy. Adjust salt and pepper to taste at the end. See notes for serving suggestions!
recipeInstructions.name: The sauce should be thickened (cook with lid off for a bit if not thick enough) and glossy. Adjust salt and pepper to taste at the end. See notes for serving suggestions!

review.reviewBody: This came out delicious but next time I might decrease or cut the cayenne out completely. It was very spicy for baked beans. My kids weren't too keen on the spice level. I used pre prepped pinto beans I had made from dry. This was easy to follow and very tasty
Adzuki Beans Calories  Adzuki beans are often used in sweet dishes, such as red bean paste. This paste is a common filling for Asian pastries, desserts, and sweet buns.
Absolute winner, I usually cook longer for even more flavour and works great in slow cooker too! For added wow factor try maple infused bacon

Forlorning over the fact that this dog has a much more glamorous life than I will ever have.
Comforting myself with these beans.
It's all good except for the canned beans.
This is about the tenth time cooking what can only be described as a very tasty dish. No one tires of eating this in the family....
Just cooked this... Sooo easy. The house smells great!
I made this to take to a barbecue, and they were a huuuuge hit! Someone who doesn‚Äôt normally care for baked beans even said he loved them. They are indeed so very delicious!! Thank you!
YUM!!! This recipe is so delicious and freezes easily for the most gourmet weekend breakfasts. I'll be cooking again and again and again!

Well, this recipe has me shaking my head in awe!
Beans this way are an absolute taste fess! I'm still getting tingles of taste coming in well after eating them. 12 out of 10!
I also had them with ciabatta toast which was another win

keywords: baked beans from scratch, baked beans recipe, southern baked beans
